isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS DT 466 and DT 530 - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - ECM Voltage Test

entry.para: Use a DMM to measure ECM voltage while cranking the engine [min 130 rpm (26 Hz)] for 20 seconds: For procedure 1 or 2 below.
1. Connect breakout tee ZTSE4484 between IPR valve and IPR harness connector. Measure voltage at connector pin A and chassis ground while cranking. See figure D on back of form.
2. Connect Breakout Box to vehicle harness connector on ECM. Measure voltage at breakout box pins (21+ & 1-), (22+ & 2-), (24+ & 23-) while cranking. See figure E on back of form.
If voltage is low, See ECM diagnostics.

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: Do this test only if the EST is not available. To determine the voltage available to the Electronic Control Module (ECM). The ECM requires 7 volts minimum to operate and drive the fuel injectors. Use the following test procedure if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is unavailable or fails to function correctly. Low battery power or an electronic failure may inhibit the EST from receiving diagnostic data.

para.emph: Tests must be done with fully charged batteries.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, do not under any circumstances allow smoking, an electric spark or open flame near the battery or explosion may occur.

step1.para: Turn accessories OFF and connect a Digital Multimeter (DMM) across the battery terminals.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, be certain that the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is applied, and drive wheels are blocked prior to cranking engine.

step1.para: Record the lowest voltage. If the voltage is below 7 volts, the ECM power relay may be resetting, resulting from low voltage and current from the batteries, or problems in the starting system.
If voltage is within specification, perform Voltage Measurement At ECM with Breakout Tee on IPR or Breakout Box.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Voltage Measurement with Breakout Tee

step1.para: Remove the IPR harness from the IPR sensor.
Install IPR Breakout Tee ZTSE4484 between sensor and harness.

figure.caption: ECM Voltage Measurement with Breakout Tee

step1.para: Place the DMM negative lead (black) onto a clean ground. Place the DMM positive lead (red) to Pin A . See ECM Voltage Measurement with Breakout Tee .
Record the lowest voltage for pin A (red) while the engine is cranking for 20 seconds minimum.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Voltage Measurement with Breakout Box

step1.para: Remove the 60 pin chassis (lower) connector harness from the ECM.
Install the Breakout Box connector to the chassis female connection on the ECM. Reconnect the chassis harness connector to the Breakout Box connector.

note.para: Torque Connector to ECM To 50 in·lbs (5.65 N·m).

step1.para: Connect leads of the voltmeter to each test point (21+ & 1-), (22+ & 2-), (24+ & 23-) on the Breakout Box. See Measuring ECM Voltage with Breakout Box .
Record the lowest voltage for each test point while cranking engine.
If voltage is lower than 7 volts, repair the ECM power feed circuit. Refer to ECM Power Circuit diagnostics.

figure.caption: Measuring ECM Voltage with Breakout Box

item.para: Low battery voltage - Failed batteries, high resistance at battery cable connections, or defective starter.

Low or no battery voltage to the ECM - Can be caused by high resistance, or an open power feed circuit to the ECM or its power relay. The ECM power circuit fuse in battery box may be open, or the ECM power relay may be defective.
Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software
If DTC's are set, see DTC column on Engine Diagnostic Trouble Codes .

para.emph: To troubleshoot low voltage at ECM Power Supply see:

item.para: Electronic Control Module Power Supply Diagram
Electronic Control Module Power Supply Circuit
